channel.title: Unlisted midi controller - is it really not working?
channel.description:
Hello everybody,
I have this 1999 Behringer class 2 mixer with midi out and I wanted to try to connect it to the Axoloti (note, I'm a complete noob) Maybe for that to work was quite optimistic in the first place, but I don't really know how all of this works (yet) and I thought well if it has a midi out I can connect it and it's going to work... Well...
I have all the latest versions installed and worked through the topics I could find on midi devices (it's not listed as compatible, neither as uncompatible)
In the patch I used a midi in monitor. I read in another post that it shows the incoming data on the console, which is the little window that opens first when you start the program I reckon. However no data shows up when I do stuff on the mixer. Now, I don't know if I have to put different settings on the mixer or maybe change something in the program or if it's just not going to work with this old mixer. I just find it very hard to give that idea up....
Maybe someone with more experience can tell me what is going on... Thanks for your effort!!

item.title: Unlisted midi controller - is it really not working?
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

also, put up here the exact model number so we can look it up...maybe it uses sysex instead of cc messages.

Read full topic
item.source: Unlisted midi controller - is it really not working?

item.title: Unlisted midi controller - is it really not working?
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

if it has a DIN midi plug it should work. compatibility issues can come from non standard USB-Midi devices. so can you test if the mixer works with another piece of gear, i.e. a computer with a midi device connected or a hardware synth?

Read full topic
item.source: Unlisted midi controller - is it really not working?
